column4: i have pasted my rules on the pastebin: http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/8DZwhjSG can anyone tell me why the server is not able to make any outgoing connections ?

ports? NAT/IP Masquerading forwards packets. Port forwarding is a different but related issue and by default, you'd have to manually specify what external ports are mapped to what internal ports (and to which machine.) Read on iptables.
that sounds very simple so why not use ufw?
ufw default deny outgoing; ufw allow out ssh
